resources.string:
Consult your doctor immediately or call the helpline number- 1075 (toll-free) or 011-23978046 
Follow doctor’s advice and undergo laboratory tests if suggested by your doctor. 
Strictly follow home isolation and avoid any kind of contact with anyone. 
The best way to prevent Coronavirus is by following preventive measures. Therefore, please follow precautionary measures (mentioned below) to protect yourself and others. 
Please stay alert and educate yourself with the latest updates from WHO
Based on your Coronavirus risk scan, Bione team of experts recommends:

Your intestines harbour billions of bacteria that have a profound effect on your health including your body’s response to Coronavirus. This gut flora plays a major role in the optimal functioning of your immune system. My Microbiome test can identify microbial imbalance in your gut which can affect your immunity against Coronavirus.
Revolutionary product which tells you about the presence of COVID-19 within 5-10 mins. It is a self-use diagnostic test for CORONAVIRUS which can be used in the comfort of your home.
Consult health care provider.\n Avoid all contact

Follow preventive measures 
The best way to prevent Coronavirus is by following preventive measures. Therefore, please follow precautionary measures (mentioned below) to protect yourself and others.
Stay home and avoid meeting others or being a part of any gathering. This will prevent the spread of infection.
Please stay alert and educate yourself with the latest updates from WHO
Your DNA may have gene variants which can make you more vulnerable to viruses. This test can detect those variants and find out your susceptibility to Coronavirus.
For more information related to Bione products & services please visit www.bione.in or email us on marketing@bione.in

According to your answers, you have a high risk of Coronavirus infection. You need to immediately seek medical care and get yourself tested. Call the helpline number- 1075 (toll-free) or 011-23978046 Till you get medical care, strictly stay in home isolation and avoid any contact with anyone. Please follow precautionary measures (mentioned below) to protect yourself and others. Please stay alert and educate yourself with the latest updates from WHO
